articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…
articleContent:
Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel complete its announced 15% workforce reduction by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel confirms the completion of its announced 15% workforce reduction (approximately 15,000 jobs) by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from an official Intel statement, press release, or financial report. If Intel announces a different percentage of job cuts or does not complete the reduction by the specified date, this question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…
articleContent:
Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel's stock price increase by 10% or more from its October 1, 2023 closing price by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel's stock price increases by 10% or more from its closing price on October 1, 2023, by August 31, 2024. The stock price will be based on the closing price on the last trading day of August 2024. If the stock price does not reach this threshold or if Intel is delisted, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around
articleDescription: Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its massive workforce — about 15,000 jobs — as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD. The Santa Clara, California-based company said Thursday it is also suspen…
articleContent:
Chipmaker Intel says it is cutting 15% of its huge workforce about 15,000 jobs as it tries to turn its business around to compete with more successful rivals like Nvidia and AMD.
In a memo to staff,… [+4460 chars]
fqTitle: Will Intel announce a new CEO by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel officially announces a new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) to replace the current CEO, Pat Gelsinger, by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Intel statement or press release. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Pat Gelsinger remains as CEO, this question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around

fqTitle: Will Intel's market share in the PC processor market fall below 70% by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if a reputable market research firm (such as IDC, Gartner, or Mercury Research) reports that Intel's market share in the PC processor market has fallen below 70% by August 31, 2024. If no such report is published or if Intel's market share remains at or above 70%, this question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Intel to lay off more than 15% of its workforce as it cuts costs to try to turn its business around

fqTitle: Will Intel announce a merger or acquisition valued at over $1 billion by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Intel officially announces a merger with another company or an acquisition of another company valued at over $1 billion by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Intel statement or press release. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if any announced deals are valued at $1 billion or less, this question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre
articleDescription: Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month ahead of his 100th birthday with a musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre. The Carter Center said Thursday that the Sept. 17 event will be called “Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song” and will featur…
articleContent:
ATLANTA (AP) Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month, ahead of his 100th birthday, with a musical gala at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta, The Carter Center announced Thursday. 
The Sept… [+1834 chars]
fqTitle: Will a musical gala honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday be held at Atlanta's Fox Theatre by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if a musical gala titled 'Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song' or a similarly named event honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday is held at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta by August 31, 2024. The event must be confirmed to have taken place as planned on September 17, 2023, or on a rescheduled date before the resolution deadline. If the event is canceled or does not occur by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre
articleDescription: Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month ahead of his 100th birthday with a musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre. The Carter Center said Thursday that the Sept. 17 event will be called “Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song” and will featur…
articleContent:
ATLANTA (AP) Former President Jimmy Carter will be honored next month, ahead of his 100th birthday, with a musical gala at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta, The Carter Center announced Thursday. 
The Sept… [+1834 chars]
fqTitle: Will Jimmy Carter attend a musical gala celebrating his 100th birthday in person by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if Jimmy Carter physically attends the 'Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song' gala or a similarly named event honoring his 100th birthday at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta, either on the planned date of September 17, 2023, or on a rescheduled date before August 31, 2024. The question resolves as NO if Carter does not attend in person, if the event is canceled, or if it does not occur by the resolution date.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre

fqTitle: Will a musical gala honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday feature at least one Grammy-winning artist by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if at least one Grammy Award-winning artist performs at the 'Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song' gala or a similarly named event honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta. The event must take place either on September 17, 2023, or on a rescheduled date before August 31, 2024. The question resolves as NO if no Grammy-winning artists perform, if the event is canceled, or if it does not occur by the resolution date.

articleTitle: Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday to be celebrated with musical gala at Atlanta's Fox Theatre

fqTitle: Will tickets for a musical gala honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday at Atlanta's Fox Theatre sell out within 24 hours of going on sale by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if tickets for the 'Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song' gala or a similarly named event honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta sell out within 24 hours of being made available to the public. The ticket sale must occur before August 31, 2024. The question resolves as NO if tickets do not sell out within 24 hours, if the event is canceled, or if ticket sales do not begin by the resolution date.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
articleDescription: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
articleContent:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will India complete the transfer of a $300 million loan to Vietnam for maritime security by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, India has completed the transfer of a $300 million loan to Vietnam specifically for the purpose of building up Vietnam's maritime security. The transfer must be officially confirmed by either the Indian or Vietnamese government, or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the loan amount is altered but remains within 10% of the original $300 million, it will still be considered valid for this question. The question will resolve as NO if the loan transfer is not completed by the specified date, if it is canceled, or if the purpose of the loan is significantly changed from maritime security.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
articleDescription: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
articleContent:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will India and Vietnam announce they have doubled their trade volume by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official representatives from both India and Vietnam jointly announce that they have successfully doubled their bilateral trade volume compared to the levels reported in October 2023. The announcement must be made through official government channels or reported by at least two reputable international news agencies. The question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made by the specified date, if the reported increase in trade volume is less than double, or if either country officially states that the goal has not been achieved.

articleTitle: India offers $300 million loan to build up Vietnam's maritime security, saying it is a key partner
articleDescription: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…
articleContent:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]
fqTitle: Will Vietnam announce the completion of a major maritime security project funded by India by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Vietnamese government officially announces the completion of a significant maritime security project that was funded, wholly or in part, by the loan offered by India. The project must be directly related to enhancing Vietnam's maritime security capabilities. The announcement should be made through official Vietnamese government channels or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made by the specified date, if the announced project is unrelated to maritime security, or if it's explicitly stated that the project was not funded by the Indian loan.

articleTitle: Marketing firm fined $40,000 for 2022 GOP mailers in New Hampshire
articleDescription: New Hampshire authorities say a Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 state primary violated the law. The attorney general's office said Thursday that forms su…
articleContent: CONCORD, N.H. (AP) A Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 New Hampshire state primary violated the… [+1158 chars]
fqTitle: Will a political marketing company be fined at least $50,000 for violating election laws in New Hampshire by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a political marketing company is fined $50,000 or more by New Hampshire authorities for violating election laws related to campaign materials or advertisements. The fine must be officially announced by the New Hampshire Attorney General's office or another relevant state authority. The violation must be specifically related to election laws, such as improper disclosures on campaign materials or misleading advertisements. The question will resolve as NO if no such fine is imposed or if the fine is less than $50,000.

articleTitle: Marketing firm fined $40,000 for 2022 GOP mailers in New Hampshire
articleDescription: New Hampshire authorities say a Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 state primary violated the law. The attorney general's office said Thursday that forms su…
articleContent: CONCORD, N.H. (AP) A Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 New Hampshire state primary violated the… [+1158 chars]
fqTitle: Will a state other than New Hampshire fine a political marketing company for election law violations by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, any U.S. state other than New Hampshire officially announces a fine against a political marketing company for violating state election laws. The fine must be related to campaign materials, advertisements, or other election-related activities. The announcement must come from the state's official channels, such as the Attorney General's office or the state's election board. The question resolves as NO if no such fine is announced by any other state within the specified timeframe.

articleTitle: Marketing firm fined $40,000 for 2022 GOP mailers in New Hampshire

articleContent: CONCORD, N.H. (AP) A Virginia-based political marketing company has agreed to pay a $40,000 fine to settle allegations that flyers it designed during the 2022 New Hampshire state primary violated the… [+1158 chars]
fqTitle: Will New Hampshire authorities announce an investigation into at least three political marketing companies for potential election law violations by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the New Hampshire Attorney General's office or another relevant state authority publicly announces investigations into three or more distinct political marketing companies for potential violations of state election laws. The investigations must be related to campaign materials, advertisements, or other election-related activities. The announcement must clearly identify that multiple companies are under investigation, even if specific company names are not provided. The question resolves as NO if fewer than three companies are announced to be under investigation within the specified timeframe.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger
articleDescription: An inmate has been sentenced to more than four years in connection with the 2018 prison slaying of notorious Boston gangster James “Whitey” Bulger. Paul J. DeCologero was sentenced Thursday. He was accused of being a lookout while another inmate…
articleContent: CLARKSBURG, W.Va. (AP) An inmate was sentenced to more than four years Thursday for his role in the 2018 fatal bludgeoning of notorious Boston gangster James Whitey Bulger in a troubled West Virginia… [+4205 chars]
fqTitle: Will another inmate be sentenced for involvement in James 'Whitey' Bulger's death by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a U.S. court sentences an additional inmate (other than Paul J. DeCologero) for their involvement in the 2018 prison killing of James 'Whitey' Bulger. The sentencing must be directly related to Bulger's death and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such sentencing occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger

fqTitle: Will a federal investigation into prison safety measures be announced following the Bulger case by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a federal agency (such as the Department of Justice or the Federal Bureau of Prisons) announces an official investigation into prison safety measures, citing the James 'Whitey' Bulger case as a contributing factor. The announcement must be made through official channels and reported by multiple mainstream news outlets. If no such investigation is announced by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger

fqTitle: Will a new policy to protect high-profile inmates in federal prisons be implemented by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Federal Bureau of Prisons or another relevant U.S. government agency implements a new policy specifically designed to enhance the protection of high-profile inmates in federal prisons. The policy must be officially announced and directly reference lessons learned from incidents such as the James 'Whitey' Bulger case. If no such policy is implemented and announced by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Inmate sentenced to more than 4 years in prison killing of Boston gangster James ‘Whitey’ Bulger
articleDescription: An inmate has been sentenced to more than four years in connection with the 2018 prison slaying of notorious Boston gangster James “Whitey” Bulger. Paul J. DeCologero was sentenced Thursday. He was accused of being a lookout while another inmate…
articleContent: CLARKSBURG, W.Va. (AP) An inmate was sentenced to more than four years Thursday for his role in the 2018 fatal bludgeoning of notorious Boston gangster James Whitey Bulger in a troubled West Virginia… [+4205 chars]
fqTitle: Will a book about the prison killing of James 'Whitey' Bulger be announced by a major publisher by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major publishing house (such as Penguin Random House, HarperCollins, Simon & Schuster, or equivalent) announces the upcoming publication of a book primarily focused on the 2018 prison killing of James 'Whitey' Bulger. The announcement must be official and reported by reputable news sources. If no such book announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will the US and Russia complete another prisoner swap involving at least 3 individuals by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States and Russia conduct another prisoner exchange involving at least three individuals (in total, across both countries). The swap must be officially confirmed by government sources or widely reported by reputable international news organizations. The question resolves as NO if no such swap occurs by the specified date or if a swap involves fewer than three individuals.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will Evan Gershkovich publish a book about his detention in Russia by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Evan Gershkovich, the U.S. journalist released in the recent US-Russia prisoner swap, publishes a book (in any format, including e-book) detailing his experiences during his detention in Russia. The book must be officially released and available for purchase from major book retailers. It resolves as NO if no such book is published by the specified date.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…

fqTitle: Will a US journalist be detained in Russia on espionage charges by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a journalist holding U.S. citizenship is detained in Russia on charges of espionage or related accusations. The detention must be officially reported by Russian authorities and confirmed by U.S. government sources or widely reported by major international news organizations. It resolves as NO if no such detention occurs by the specified date.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…
articleContent: WASHINGTON (AP) The United States and Russia completed their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history on Thursday, with Moscow releasing journalist Evan Gershkovich and fellow American Paul Whela… [+5197 chars]
fqTitle: Will the US State Department issue a travel advisory against Russia for US journalists by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Department of State issues an official travel advisory specifically warning U.S. journalists about the risks of traveling to Russia. The advisory must explicitly mention journalists or media professionals as a targeted group. It resolves as NO if no such specific advisory is issued by the specified date.

articleTitle: Largest and most complex East-West prisoner swap since Cold War...
articleDescription: The United States and Russia have made their biggest prisoner swap in post-Soviet history. Moscow on Thursday released U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich and Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan along with dissidents including Vladimir Kara-Murza i…

fqTitle: Will Vladimir Kara-Murza be nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vladimir Kara-Murza, the Russian dissident released in the recent US-Russia prisoner swap, is officially nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize. The nomination must be confirmed by the Nobel Committee or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. It resolves as NO if no such nomination is made or confirmed by the specified date.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.
Jobl… [+2061 chars]
fqTitle: Will the number of Americans filing for jobless claims exceed 300,000 in a single week by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Labor reports that the number of Americans filing for initial unemployment benefits (jobless claims) exceeds 300,000 in any single week. The resolution will be based on the official weekly report released by the U.S. Department of Labor. If no such report shows jobless claims exceeding 300,000 in a single week by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.
Jobl… [+2061 chars]
fqTitle: Will the U.S. unemployment rate remain below 5% through August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. unemployment rate, as reported by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, remains below 5% for all monthly reports from October 2023 through August 2024. If the unemployment rate reaches or exceeds 5% in any monthly report during this period, the question will resolve as NO. The resolution will be based on the official monthly employment situation reports released by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

articleTitle: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims hits highest level in a year
articleDescription: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains broadly healthy. Jobless claims for the week ending July 27 climbed by 14,000 to249,000 from 235,000 the previous week, …
articleContent:
The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits jumped to its highest level in a year last week, even as the labor market remains surprisingly healthy in an era of high interest rates.
Jobl… [+2061 chars]
fqTitle: Will a week of jobless claims in the U.S. surpass the July 2023 high by August 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Labor reports a week where the number of Americans filing for initial unemployment benefits (jobless claims) exceeds the high of 249,000 recorded in July 2023. The resolution will be based on the official weekly jobless claims reports released by the U.S. Department of Labor. If no such report shows jobless claims surpassing 249,000 in a single week by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
articleContent:
The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will a U.S. rule banning airlines from charging parents to sit with young children be implemented by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Transportation implements a rule that prohibits airlines from charging additional fees for parents to sit with their children aged 13 or younger on flights. The rule must be officially enacted and in effect. If the rule is not implemented, or if it is significantly altered from the proposal described in the article, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
articleContent:
The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will a major U.S. airline voluntarily adopt a policy to seat children with parents at no extra charge by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one of the top 5 U.S. airlines by passenger volume announces and implements a policy to seat children aged 13 or younger with their parents or guardians without charging additional fees. The policy must be publicly announced and put into practice. If no such policy is adopted by any major U.S. airline, or if the policies implemented still allow for additional charges in some cases, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Proposed rule would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their children
articleDescription: The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents to sit with their young children. Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…
articleContent:
The U.S. Department of Transportation is proposing a new rule that would ban airlines from charging parents more to sit with their young children.
Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and for… [+2672 chars]
fqTitle: Will there be significant pushback from airlines against the proposed seating rule for children by August, 2024?
fqBody: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least three major U.S. airlines or airline industry associations publicly oppose or file formal objections to the Department of Transportation's proposed rule to ban charges for seating children with parents. Opposition must be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If fewer than three major airlines or associations publicly oppose the rule, or if opposition is not widely reported, the question resolves as NO.

articleTitle: Police fire gunshots and tear gas to quell mass protests over Nigeria's economy. At least 2 killed

fqTitle: Will Nigeria declare a state of emergency due to mass protests by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Nigerian government officially declares a state of emergency in response to ongoing mass protests related to the country's economic situation. The declaration must be made by the President or an authorized government official and reported by at least two major international news outlets. The state of emergency must be nationwide or cover at least three major cities. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the confirmed death toll from protests related to Nigeria's economic situation reaches or exceeds 10 people. The death toll must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations and attributed directly to protest-related incidents, including clashes with security forces. If the reported death toll remains below 10 by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major international organization (such as the United Nations, International Monetary Fund, or World Bank) announces a significant intervention or aid package specifically aimed at addressing Nigeria's economic crisis and related protests. The intervention must be valued at least $100 million USD and be officially announced by the organization. If no such intervention is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

fqTitle: Will Nigeria's government implement major economic reforms in response to protests by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's government announces and begins implementing a set of major economic reforms in direct response to the ongoing protests. These reforms must include at least two of the following: significant currency policy changes, major subsidy adjustments, or substantial changes to fiscal policy. The reforms must be officially announced by the government and reported by at least two major international news outlets. If no such reforms are implemented by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

fqTitle: Will the NHTSA conclude its investigation into the Tesla 'Full Self-Driving' crash near Seattle by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) officially concludes and releases findings from its investigation into the April 2023 crash near Seattle involving a Tesla operating on 'Full Self-Driving' mode that resulted in a motorcyclist fatality. The conclusion must be publicly announced through official NHTSA channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If the investigation remains ongoing or no official conclusion is released by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

fqTitle: Will Tesla suspend its 'Full Self-Driving' feature in the United States by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tesla officially announces a suspension or temporary halt of its 'Full Self-Driving' feature for vehicles in the United States. The suspension must be company-wide and apply to all Tesla vehicles equipped with the feature. The announcement must be made through official Tesla channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If Tesla continues to offer the 'Full Self-Driving' feature without interruption until the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

fqTitle: Will a U.S. state ban Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' feature by August 2024?
fqBody: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state enacts legislation or issues an executive order that explicitly bans or prohibits the use of Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' feature on public roads within that state. The ban must be officially announced by the state government and reported by at least two major news outlets. If no U.S. state has implemented such a ban by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.
